Description: Three fragments and one flaked chip of belly of broad Clazomenian or East Greek black figure painted pottery vessel (hydria?). Scales containing white drops.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Perhaps from the same hydria as 1888,0208.80.a. BSA xlvii, 143 n. 102-no.10.
Findspot according to original register and association with BM GR 1888,0208.80.a. No marks on the back of the sherd themselves, which are flaked.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (pl. GB 590, 24-26)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 145)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
